It’s been nearly 2 years since President Trump’s tax reform package became law.

This funding is important - not only because it gives states more resources, but because it reflects an increased focus on protecting our election infrastructure. I’m proud of the role the Senate Intel Committee has played in highlighting this critical issue.

The Senate just approved another $425 million to strengthen election security ahead of the 2020 elections.
 
That makes $805 million sent to states for election security improvements since 2016.⬇️ https://apnews.com/8a00173242774e226a5ea924a9c9d127 …

Earlier this year, Congress renewed #PAHPA to ensure America remains vigilant against the public health threats we face in the 21st century
 
I’m proud that the emergency response framework we helped build more than a decade ago is stronger than ever. 2/2

In 2006, Sen. Ted Kennedy and I worked across the aisle to craft a bill that would strengthen America’s defenses against pandemics and bioterrorism.
 
Today is the 13th anniversary of the Pandemic and All-Hazards Preparedness Act (#PAHPA) being signed into law. 1/2

#WrightBrothersDay commemorates the first successful flight of a manned, engine-powered aircraft – and the two men who changed history at Kitty Hawk, N.C. with their persistence and ingenuity. North Carolina will always be proud to be #FirstInFlight. pic.twitter.com/L7xU5UEf3V

The Senate just passed a significant boost for our Armed Forces. The #FY20NDAA will:
 
✔️Invest in our Intel Community
✔️Rebuild NC military bases damaged by hurricanes
✔️Modernize our military readiness programs
✔️Provide a 3.1% pay raise to our troops
